text: Jimmy Carter's 1976 presidential campaign was a successful campaign for Carter and his running mate Walter Mondale's election as President and Vice President of the United States. They beat the incumbent Republican President Gerald Ford and his running mate Bob Dole. Carter, a Democrat and Governor of Georgia launched his presidential bid in December 1974. In the break of the Watergate scandal, the declining popularity of President Ford because of his pardon of Richard Nixon. His opponents made fun of his supporters by saying, "Jimmy, who?". In response to it, Carter started to say "My name is Jimmy Carter, and I'm running for president". ==References== Carter 1976 Category:Jimmy Carter
title: Jimmy Carter 1976 presidential campaign
